answerText: Gerard Manley Hopkins[10] This poem by Hopkins is unsurprisingly dedicated to "Christ our Lord," and the narrator of this poem admires a falcon that glides in the air before attacking its prey.
heading: MUT |2012 | 3 | 11 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This poet used his system of sprung rhythm in a poem dedicated to the "happy memory" of five nuns who died aboard a ship. For 10 points each: [10] Name this English poet of  "The Wreck of the Deutschland," almost all of whose poetry had basis in his Jesuit faith. He praised God for "dappled things" in the poem "Pied Beauty."
